skill.name: scenario-testing
skill.description: This skill should be used when writing tests, validating features, or needing to verify code works. Triggers on "write tests", "add test coverage", "validate feature", "integration test", "end-to-end", "e2e test", "mock", "unit test". Enforces scenario-driven testing with real dependencies in .scratch/ directory.
skill.summary: This skill should be used when writing tests, validating features, or needing to verify code works. ...
skill.author: 2389-research

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no code execution, no file access, no network calls, no external commands. Only provides testing methodology guidance through Markdown instructions.

content.user_title: Enforce scenario testing with real dependencies
content.value_statement: Mock-based testing creates false confidence in code quality. This skill enforces end-to-end scenario testing with real system dependencies to validate that features actually work.
actual_capabilities: Detects when user wants to write or validate tests
Enforces scenario-driven testing with real dependencies
Guides creation of .scratch/ scenarios with zero mocks
Extracts patterns to scenarios.jsonl for documentation
limitations: Requires test infrastructure with real dependencies available
Cannot replace unit tests for isolated logic verification
Not suitable for systems without test environments

use_cases.title: Validate features before completion
use_cases.description: Write end-to-end scenarios to prove new features work with real systems.

use_cases.title: Create integration test suites
use_cases.description: Build comprehensive scenario suites that exercise complete user workflows.

use_cases.title: Establish testing standards
use_cases.description: Define team-wide requirements for mock-free testing and pattern documentation.

prompt_templates.title: Write feature test
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a scenario test for [feature] that exercises real dependencies. Create .scratch/test-[feature].py and run it to verify it passes.

prompt_templates.title: Replace mocks
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert this test to use real dependencies instead of mocks. Hit actual services in test mode. Document the pattern in scenarios.jsonl.

prompt_templates.title: Validate bug fix
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a scenario test that reproduces the original bug. Run it to confirm the fix works. Keep it in .scratch/ for regression testing.

prompt_templates.title: Build test suite
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a complete scenario test suite for [module]. Each scenario must run independently, use real dependencies, and follow the pattern in scenarios.jsonl.

output_examples.input: Write tests for the user registration feature
output: I'll create a scenario test with real dependencies.

{"name":"user-registration","description":"User can register with email and password","given":"New user credentials","when":"User submits registration form","then":"User record exists in database and can authenticate","validates":"Registration flow"}

best_practices: Each scenario must be standalone and run independently without prior setup
Always execute scenarios to verify they pass before marking work complete
Extract recurring patterns to scenarios.jsonl to document what should work
anti_patterns: Using mocks - they test assumptions, not actual system behavior
Writing unit tests instead of scenarios - they do not validate features
Committing scratch scenarios - they belong in .gitignore

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Triggers on test-related keywords like 'write tests', 'validate feature', 'integration test', 'mock', 'e2e'.

faq.question: How many test scenarios should I write?
faq.answer: Write one scenario per user workflow. Each scenario must exercise real dependencies end-to-end. More scenarios mean better coverage.

faq.question: Can I use sandbox or test mode for dependencies?
faq.answer: Yes. Sandbox and test modes are acceptable. The key requirement is real dependencies, not production data. Use test databases and mock services.

faq.question: Is my test data safe?
faq.answer: Scenarios live in .scratch/ which is gitignored. Test data stays local or in test environments. Patterns extracted to scenarios.jsonl contain no real data.

faq.question: What if my system has no test environment?
faq.answer: This skill requires real dependencies. Ask your team to set up test infrastructure. Without it, scenarios cannot validate real system behavior.

faq.question: How is this different from unit tests?
faq.answer: Unit tests verify isolated functions with mocks. Scenarios verify complete features with real systems. Unit tests provide comfort; scenarios provide truth.
